equipment1.name: Cloth
equipment1.description:
Mundane Armor (Light)

Jackets, mantles, woven robes, and padded vests don’t, by themselves, provide any significant protection. However, you can imbue them with protective magic. Cloth armor doesn’t slow you down or hinder your movement at all. All characters are proficient with cloth armor.

equipment2.name: Spiked Plate
equipment2.description:
Base Type: Plate

Mundane Armor (Heavy) (Superior)

A dwarven innovation, spiked plate is a suit of plate mail studded with sharp, metal spikes. The dwarves developed this armor to deal with subterranean beasts such as hook horrors and umber hulks that grasp and crush their prey.

Barbed: A suit of barbed armor or is covered with spikes and hooks designed to injure creatures foolish enough to grab at it. While you wear barbed armor a creature takes damage equal to 5 + your level when you escape that creature's grab on your turn or when that creature escapes your grab.

equipment3.name: Light Shield
equipment3.description:
Mundane Armor (Shield)

You need to use your shield hand to wield a light shield properly. You can still use that hand to hold another item, to climb, or the like. However, you can’t use your shield hand to make attacks

Shield Bonus: Shields give a bonus to both AC and Reflex. Furthermore, you can carry small objects while wielding a light shield, but cannot carry anything in a heavy-shield wielding hand.

equipment4.name: Dagger
equipment4.description:
Mundane Weapon Simple Melee 1H

Light thrown: A ranged basic attack with a light thrown weapon uses your Dexterity modifier for the attack and damage rolls, unless otherwise noted in the description of the power used.

Off-hand: An off-hand weapon is light enough that you can hold it and attack effectively with it while also holding a weapon in your main hand. You can't attack with both weapons in the same turn, unless you have a power that allows such an attack, but you can attack with either weapon.

equipment6.name: Alhulak
equipment6.description:
Mundane Weapon Military Melee 1H

Versatile: Versatile weapons are one-handed weapons that can be used two-handed. If you do, use the damage dice in parentheses instead of the weapon's usual damage dice.

equipment7.name: Falchion
equipment7.description:
Mundane Weapon Military Melee 2H

A falchion features a long, wide blade that bends in a curve, similar to that of a [item:307603].

High Crit: Whenever you score a critical strike with this weapon add 1[W] damage. This improves by 1[W] every 5 levels, up to 6[W] at level 26.

equipment8.name: Fullblade
equipment8.description:
Mundane Weapon Superior Melee 2H

This enormous, two-handed sword requires special training to use effectively

Defensive: You gain a +1 bonus to AC while wielding a defensive weapon

equipment9.name: Rapier
equipment9.description:
Mundane Weapon Military Melee 1H

A weapon of choice for the sophisticated duelist, the rapier is a long, light blade ideal for parrying blows and delivering quick counterattacks.

equipment10.name: Shortsword
equipment10.description:
Mundane Weapon Military Melee 1H

Off-hand: An off-hand weapon is light enough that you can hold it and attack effectively with it while also holding a weapon in your main hand. You can't attack with both weapons in the same turn, unless you have a power that allows such an attack, but you can attack with either weapon.

equipment11.name: Crossbow
equipment11.description:
Mundane Weapon Simple Ranged 2H

Load Minor: Ranged weapons that loose projectiles, including bows, crossbows, and slings, take some time to load. The crossbow is “load minor,” which means it requires a minor action to load a bolt into the weapon. If a power allows you to hit multiple targets, the additional load time is accounted for in the power

equipment12.name: Khopesh
equipment12.description:
Mundane Weapon Military Melee 1H

This sturdy weapon is identified by the crescent-shaped curve at the end of its blade.

Brutal 1: Whenever you roll 1 or lower on a damage die using this power, reroll that die.

Versatile: Versatile weapons are one-handed weapons that can be used two-handed. If you do, use the damage dice in parentheses instead of the weapon's usual damage dice.

equipment13.name: Broadsword
equipment13.description:
Mundane Weapon Military Melee 1H

This stout, wide-bladed weapon lacks the accuracy of a [item:239950], but what it lacks in accuracy, it redeems with deadliness.

Versatile: Versatile weapons are one-handed weapons that can be used two-handed. If you do, use the damage dice in parentheses instead of the weapon's usual damage dice.

equipment14.name: Rod
equipment14.description:
Mundane Implement

Rods are short sticks of intricately adorned wood, metal, and hide, useful for channeling raw magical energy.

equipment15.name: Leather
equipment15.description:
Mundane Armor (Light)

Leather armor is sturdier than cloth armor. It protects vital areas with multiple layers of boiled-leather plates, while covering the limbs with supple leather that provides a small amount of protection.

equipment16.name: Hide
equipment16.description:
Mundane Armor (Light)

Thicker and heavier than leather, hide armor is composed of skin from any creature that has a tough hide, such as a bear, a griffon, or a dragon. Hide armor can bind and slightly hinder your precision, but it’s light enough that it doesn’t affect your speed.

equipment17.name: Ring Mail
equipment17.description:
Base Type: Scale

Mundane Armor (Heavy) (Superior)

This flexible but sturdy armor consists of a typical suit ofleather armor with a series of metal rings sewn onto its surface. The rings enhance the armor's sturdiness, improving its protective qualities while still offering the maneuverability of lightweight armor.

Manueverable: This armor does not impose disadvantage on stealth checks

equipment18.name: Plate
equipment18.description:
Mundane Armor (Heavy)

The heaviest type of armor, made up of shaped plates of metal or similarly resilient material, plate provides the most armor protection. The cost for its superior fortification is mobility and agility.

equipment19.name: Longsword
equipment19.description:
Mundane Weapon Military Melee 1H

Versatile: Versatile weapons are one-handed weapons that can be used two-handed. If you do, use the damage dice in parentheses instead of the weapon's usual damage dice.

equipment20.name: Ball Bearings
equipment20.description:
Mundane Equipment

Ball bearings can be scattered across a 5' square as a standard action to turn it into difficult terrain. Characters may choose to ignore the terrain by making a saving throw - if they succeed they ignore the speed penalty, if they fail they fall prone.

equipment21.name: Block, Tackle, and Winch
equipment21.description:
Mundane Equipment

Block, Tackle, and Winch After you attach this set of simple machines to a solid surface, you can pass a rope through it to triple the weight you can lift, pull, or drag on the other end of the rope

equipment22.name: Caltrops
equipment22.description:
Mundane Equipment

Ball bearings can be scattered across a 5' square to turn it into difficult terrain. Characters may choose to ignore the terrain by making a saving throw - if they succeed they ignore the speed penalty, if they fail they are slowed (save ends).

equipment23.name: Candle Clock
equipment23.description:
Mundane Equipment

Candle Clock provide minimal light, but can keep accurate time for up to 8 hours

equipment24.name: Chain (10')
equipment24.description:
Mundane Equipment

Chain (10') is a flexible way of securing doors, prisoners, or attaching two objects.

equipment25.name: Chalk
equipment25.description:
Mundane Equipment

Chalk can be used to draw marks or communicate

equipment26.name: Slate
equipment26.description:
Mundane Equipment

Slate is a platform to draw [item:244391] on

equipment27.name: Chirurgeon's Kit
equipment27.description:
Mundane Equipment (Kit)

Chirurgeon's Kit give a +2 bonus to medicine checks to treat diseases and poisons

equipment28.name: Climber's Kit
equipment28.description:
Mundane Equipment (Kit)

Climber's Kit give a +2 bonus to athletics checks to climb a surface with at least 1 minute of setup

equipment29.name: Crookeye
equipment29.description:
Mundane Equipment

Crookeyes allow characters to see from adjacent squares when wielded

equipment30.name: Crowbar
equipment30.description:
Mundane Equipment

Crowbar give a +2 bonus to Strength checks to pry a chest, door, or other object open

equipment31.name: Disguise Kit
equipment31.description:
Mundane Equipment (Kit)

Disguise Kit give a +2 bonus to Impress checks to act as another person. A disguise kit can only confer a benefit to a single target at a time and takes at least one hour to set up

equipment32.name: Flask (Empty)
equipment32.description:
Mundane Equipment

Flask (Empty) can be used to hold up to 16 oz of liquid

equipment33.name: Flint and Steel
equipment33.description:
Mundane Equipment

Flint and Steel can be used to start fires as a standard action, assuming there is sufficient material

equipment34.name: Gambling Gear
equipment34.description:
Mundane Equipment

Gambling Gear covers playing cards, dice, or even game boards for common games of skill and luck

equipment35.name: Glass Cutter
equipment35.description:
Mundane Equipment

A Glass Cutter lets you silently cut precise pieces of glass out without shattering the whole pane

equipment36.name: Hunter's Kit
equipment36.description:
Mundane Equipment (Kit)

Hunter's Kit give a +2 bonus to survival checks to forage and acquire rations

equipment37.name: Inquisitive's Kit
equipment37.description:
Mundane Equipment (Kit)

Inquisitive's Kit give a +2 bonus to perception checks to examine a crime scene or otherwise discern past events

equipment38.name: Listening Cone
equipment38.description:
Mundane Equipment

Listening Cone grant advantage to perception checks to listen through doors or walls

equipment39.name: Manacles
equipment39.description:
Mundane Equipment

Manacles can be used to restrain hands or feet

equipment40.name: Pole (10')
equipment40.description:
Mundane Equipment

Pole (10') have all sorts of uses, but can also be used for a +2 bonus on Acrobatics to balance across a narrow surface

equipment41.name: Pole (Collapsible)
equipment41.description:
Mundane Equipment

Pole (Collapsible) are like 10' poles but are made of retracting 2' increments, out to a maximum of 12', and can be combined with other collapsible poles

equipment42.name: Rope - Hempen (50')
equipment42.description:
Mundane Equipment

Rope - Hempen (50') can be used to tie or otherwise secure objects or people

equipment43.name: Rope - Silk (50')
equipment43.description:
Mundane Equipment

Rope - Silk (50') is lighter and confers a +2 bonus to Sleight of Hand checks to use the rope

equipment44.name: Rubbing Kit
equipment44.description:
Mundane Equipment

Rubbing Kit can be used to copy an intricate inscription found on a wall or other surface for later review

equipment45.name: Iron Spike
equipment45.description:
Mundane Equipment

Iron Spikes can be driven into doors to seal them shut

equipment46.name: Surveyor's Kit
equipment46.description:
Mundane Equipment (Kit)

Surveyor's Kit give a +2 bonus to perception checks to find secret doors or traps after taking 10 minutes to set up

equipment47.name: Writing Utensils
equipment47.description:
Mundane Equipment

Writing Utensils include quill, paper, and writing ink

equipment48.name: Bedroll
equipment48.description:
Mundane Equipment

Bedroll Sleeping outdoors without a bed roll imposes a -1 penalty to all d20 rolls until the next long rest.

equipment49.name: Rations (1 day)
equipment49.description:
Mundane Equipment

Rations usually consist of Ghallanda bread plus some mix of local fruits and vegetables. See survival rules for usage.

equipment50.name: Tent
equipment50.description:
Mundane Equipment

Tent Sleeping outdoors without a tent is risky in hazardous weather and imposes disadvantage on checks

equipment51.name: Backpack
equipment51.description:
Mundane Equipment (Container)

Every proper adventurer owns a backpack, which usually consists of a large cloth bag with leather straps to go around the arms.

equipment52.name: Barrel
equipment52.description:
Mundane Equipment (Container)

While not convenient for regular adventurers, barrels are an efficient means of holding things in combination with a mobile platform

equipment54.name: Sack
equipment54.description:
Mundane Equipment (Container)

Sacks can be made out of a wide variety of materials. Unlike a [item:244567] a sack occupies two hands to carry, but can give additional carrying capacity beyond the backpack.

equipment55.name: Arcane Signet Ring
equipment55.description:
Mundane Equipment (Identification)

Arcane Signet Ring are used to guarantee signatures and are manufactured jointly by House Sivis and House Cannith

equipment56.name: ID Papers (Standard)
equipment56.description:
Mundane Equipment (Identification)

ID papers (Standard) are typically carried by middle and upper class members of the five nations, Zilargo, or the Mror Holds. They include a physical description, name, residence, and any affiliation to a major organization such as a Dragonmarked House.

equipment57.name: ID Papers (Picture)
equipment57.description:
Mundane Equipment (Identification)

ID papers (Picture) are higher quality than regular ID papers, and can be enchanted by the Sivis Notaries guild to show if the bearer is the person pictured for 100 gp.

equipment58.name: Letters of Credit
equipment58.description:
Mundane Equipment (Identification)

Letters of Credit represent how much value you have stored with House Kundarak and are notarized by House Sivis. The cost represents the fee for opening an account with the house.

equipment59.name: Traveling Papers
equipment59.description:
Mundane Equipment (Identification)

Traveling Papers are necessary for legal border crossing, and offer the same information as ID papers plus where and why a person is traveling.

equipment60.name: Candle
equipment60.description:
Mundane Equipment (Light)

Candles emits dim light in a 5' radius. Candles last 4 hours

equipment61.name: Everburning Torch
equipment61.description:
Mundane Equipment (Light)

Everburning Torch emits perpetual light as a torch without producing heat or smoke.

equipment62.name: Jar of glowworms
equipment62.description:
Mundane Equipment (Light)

Jar of glowworms emits dim light in the square the glowworms inhabit. The jar can easily and quickly be covered, and the worms count as living creatures for the purpose of triggering traps

equipment63.name: Lantern
equipment63.description:
Mundane Equipment (Light)

Lanterns emits bright light in a 60' radius, and dim light out to double that. Oil costs 1 sp per hour and take up 1 capacity per 8 hours of oil

equipment64.name: Sunrod
equipment64.description:
Mundane Equipment (Light)

Sunrods emit bright light in a 90' radius, and dim light out to double that, for up to two hours.

equipment65.name: Torch
equipment65.description:
Mundane Equipment (Light)

Torches emits bright light in a 30' radius, and dim light out to double that, for up to two hours.

equipment66.name: Musical Instrument
equipment66.description:
Mundane Equipment

Ex: Bagpipes, Drum, Flute, Harp, Horn, Lute, Lyre, Woodwind

Any musical instrument that would seem to be smaller/lighter is also accounting for whatever extra equipment is necessary with the instrument

equipment67.name: Alchemist's Tools
equipment67.description:
Mundane Equipment (Tool)

Alchemist's Tools are used to craft potions and throwable magic flasks.

equipment68.name: Artisan's Tools
equipment68.description:
Mundane Equipment (Tool)

Artisan's Tools include everything from brewer's tools to woodcaver's tools. They are usually used to craft other mundane items or make repairs.

equipment69.name: Forgery Tools
equipment69.description:
Mundane Equipment (Tool)

Forgery Tools are used to create fake documents

equipment70.name: Poisoner's Tools
equipment70.description:
Mundane Equipment (Tool)

Poisoner's Tools are used to craft poisons. These tools come with the recipe for [item:306957], [item:306958], [item:306962], and [item:306963].

Rules

In addition to the normal rules for a [note:226302], poisons have some special characteristics. First, poisons do not require endurance checks once per day - instead, poisons act on a faster timescale, as defined by the "Period" entry in the listing.

Second, poisons have specific vectors through which they can affect a subject, as defined by the vector entry. Vectors include 'Contact', which means the poison can be absorbed through the skin of the subject. 'Ingested' poisons require the subject to eat or drink the poison. 'Inhalation' poisons can be used as a dust and must simply be breathed in. 'Injection' poisons require the poison to directly enter the blood stream of the subject, such as by being coated on an edged weapon and dealing damage.

Crafting

During downtime periods player characters who both own poisoner's tools and have appropriate materials can craft poisons for which they have the appropriate formula. The cost of a poison depends on the level of Endurance DC's the character wishes. Severe poisons cost double an equivalent level of Mild poison. Crafting a batch of poison creates three doses, while just buying poisons only purchases one dose for the same cost.

Alternatively, a character with competency in poisoner's tools can forage for materials during downtime, even if they do not have actual poisoner's tools. The amount of materials they forage is equal to the amount of progress they could make on crafting.

equipment71.name: Thieves Tools
equipment71.description:
Mundane Equipment (Tool)

Thieves Tools are used to pick locks and disable traps

equipment72.name: Ritual Book
equipment72.description:
Mundane Equipment (Tool)

Ritual Books contain magical formulas for casting [note:226315] and can be used as a [item:307890] implement.

equipment73.name: Chainmail
equipment73.description:
Mundane Armor (Heavy)

Metal rings woven together into a shirt, leggings, and a hood make up a suit of chainmail. Chainmail grants good protection, but it’s cumbersome, so it reduces your mobility and agility

equipment74.name: Scale
equipment74.description:
Mundane Armor (Heavy)

Overlapping pieces of highly durable material, such as steel or even dragon scales, make up scale armor. Despite its heaviness, scale is surprisingly easy to wear; its straps and buckles make it adjustable and able to fit snugly on the body, allowing flexibility and agility. Mundane scale armor uses metal plates.

equipment75.name: Brigandine
equipment75.description:
Base Type: Leather

Mundane Armor (Light) (Superior)

Tough: Tough armor is reinforced with additional plates designed to protect vulnerable areas. The first time in each encounter a critical hit is scored against your AC while you're wearing tough armor, the critical hit becomes a normal hit.

equipment76.name: Lamellar
equipment76.description:
Base Type: Hide

Mundane Armor (Light) (Superior)

Tough: Tough armor is reinforced with additional plates designed to protect vulnerable areas. The first time in each encounter a critical hit is scored against your AC while you're wearing tough armor, the critical hit becomes a normal hit.

equipment77.name: Breastplate
equipment77.description:
Base Type: Chainmail

Mundane Armor (Heavy) (Superior)

 

Manueverable: This armor does not impose disadvantage on stealth checks

equipment78.name: Banded Mail
equipment78.description:
Base Type: Chainmail

Mundane Armor (Heavy) (Superior)

Banded mail consists of a suit of chainmail reinforced with layers of metal plates arranged in strips along the suit's midsection.

Tough: Tough armor is reinforced with additional plates designed to protect vulnerable areas. The first time in each encounter a critical hit is scored against your AC while you're wearing tough armor, the critical hit becomes a normal hit.

equipment79.name: Splint Mail
equipment79.description:
Base Type: Scale

Mundane Armor (Heavy) (Superior)

First developed by the dwarves, splint mail consists of vertical strips of metal bound to a thick layer ofleather and chainmail. Because it is so heavy and ponderous, few other than dwarves wear it in battle. While it lacks the protective elements of plate, it is scale armor's equal. More important, its rigid construction allows it to absorb some portion of an enemy's blows.

Tough: Tough armor is reinforced with additional plates designed to protect vulnerable areas. The first time in each encounter a critical hit is scored against your AC while you're wearing tough armor, the critical hit becomes a normal hit.

equipment80.name: Full Plate
equipment80.description:
Base Type: Plate

Mundane Armor (Heavy) (Superior)

Though the dwarves are loath to admit it, human smiths crafted the first suits of full plate for the use of mounted knights. Of course, the dwarves are quick to add, they did perfect those initial, flawed designs. Among all the kinds of heavy armor, full plate offers unmatched protection and flexibility.

Tough: Tough armor is reinforced with additional plates designed to protect vulnerable areas. The first time in each encounter a critical hit is scored against your AC while you're wearing tough armor, the critical hit becomes a normal hit.

equipment81.name: Resilient Document
equipment81.description:
Mundane Equipment

The gnomes of Zilargo are obsessed with the preservation of information. Using alchemical techniques and the exotic woods of Aerenal, the Library of Korranberg developed a material far stronger than paper or parchment. A resilient document has hardness 3 and 3 hit points; a resilient book has hardness 3 and 7 hit points per inch of thickness. A resilient document is not adversely affected by exposure to water, and has fire resistance 3, which allows it to survive temporary exposure to fire without serious damage. To create a specific sort of resilient document, add 1 gp to the base cost of that document. A resilient book (such as a wizard’s spellbook) costs an additional 100 gp.

equipment82.name: Heavy Shield
equipment82.description:
Mundane Armor (Shield)

When you use a heavy shield, you gain a greater bonus to your AC and Reflex defense, but you can’t use your shield hand for any other task.

Shield Bonus: Shields give a bonus to both AC and Reflex. Furthermore, you can carry small objects while wielding a light shield, but cannot carry anything in a heavy-shield wielding hand.

equipment83.name: Club
equipment83.description:
Mundane Weapon Simple Melee 1H

Rogue: Rogue weapons are special weapons that can be used with the Rogue's Sneak Attack class feature

equipment84.name: Javelin
equipment84.description:
Mundane Weapon Simple Melee 1H

Heavy thrown: You hurl a thrown weapon from your hand, rather than using it to loose a projectile. A ranged basic attack with a heavy thrown weapon uses your Strength instead of your Dexterity for the attack and damage rolls.

equipment85.name: Light Mace
equipment85.description:
Mundane Weapon Simple Melee 1H

The smaller races often prefer this version of the mace because of its lighter weight. It can deliver a solid, if not crushing, blow to an enemy.

Off-hand: An off-hand weapon is light enough that you can hold it and attack effectively with it while also holding a weapon in your main hand. You can't attack with both weapons in the same turn, unless you have a power that allows such an attack, but you can attack with either weapon.

Rogue: Rogue weapons are special weapons that can be used with the Rogue's Sneak Attack class feature

equipment86.name: Mace
equipment86.description:
Mundane Weapon Simple Melee 1H

Rogue: Rogue weapons are special weapons that can be used with the Rogue's Sneak Attack class feature

Versatile: Versatile weapons are one-handed weapons that can be used two-handed. If you do, use the damage dice in parentheses instead of the weapon's usual damage dice.

equipment87.name: Short spear
equipment87.description:
Mundane Weapon Simple Melee 1H

Although this weapon often serves the same role as a spear, it is more handy for the smaller races. It can also be used as a thrown weapon, unlike a full-sized [item:307048].

Light thrown A ranged basic attack with a light thrown weapon uses your Dexterity modifier for the attack and damage rolls, unless otherwise noted in the description of the power used.

Off-hand: An off-hand weapon is light enough that you can hold it and attack effectively with it while also holding a weapon in your main hand. You can't attack with both weapons in the same turn, unless you have a power that allows such an attack, but you can attack with either weapon.

equipment88.name: Sickle
equipment88.description:
Mundane Weapon Simple Melee 1H

Off-hand: An off-hand weapon is light enough that you can hold it and attack effectively with it while also holding a weapon in your main hand. You can't attack with both weapons in the same turn, unless you have a power that allows such an attack, but you can attack with either weapon.

equipment89.name: Spear
equipment89.description:
Mundane Weapon Simple Melee 1H

Versatile: Versatile weapons are one-handed weapons that can be used two-handed. If you do, use the damage dice in parentheses instead of the weapon's usual damage dice.

equipment90.name: Longspear
equipment90.description:
Mundane Weapon Simple Melee 2H

Reach: With a reach weapon, you can make melee attacks against enemies that are 2 squares away from you as well as against adjacent enemies. Even so, you can make opportunity attacks only against enemies adjacent to you and can flank only enemies adjacent to you.

equipment91.name: Morningstar
equipment91.description:
Mundane Weapon Simple Melee 2H

This fancier take on a two-handed club consists of a wooden haft topped with a spiked metal ball. The morningstar is common among mercenaries, ogres, trolls, and others that want a heavy weapon that requires little training or maintenance.

equipment92.name: Quarterstaff
equipment92.description:
Mundane Weapon Simple Melee 2H

Defensive: You gain a +1 bonus to AC while wielding a defensive weapon

equipment94.name: Battleaxe
equipment94.description:
Mundane Weapon Military Melee 1H

Versatile: Versatile weapons are one-handed weapons that can be used two-handed. If you do, use the damage dice in parentheses instead of the weapon's usual damage dice.

equipment95.name: Carrikal
equipment95.description:
Mundane Weapon Military Melee 1H

Brutal 2: Whenever you roll N or lower on a damage die using this power, reroll that die

equipment96.name: Flail
equipment96.description:
Mundane Weapon Military Melee 1H

Based on a simple agricultural tool, a flail is a wooden handle attached by a short chain to a spiked metal ball. The chain allows a skilled warrior to generate impressive force with each stroke or entangle a foe's legs or arms

Versatile: Versatile weapons are one-handed weapons that can be used two-handed. If you do, use the damage dice in parentheses instead of the weapon's usual damage dice.

equipment97.name: Handaxe
equipment97.description:
Mundane Weapon Military Melee 1H

Heavy thrown: You hurl a thrown weapon from your hand, rather than using it to loose a projectile. A ranged basic attack with a heavy thrown weapon uses your Strength instead of your Dexterity for the attack and damage rolls.

Off-hand: An off-hand weapon is light enough that you can hold it and attack effectively with it while also holding a weapon in your main hand. You can't attack with both weapons in the same turn, unless you have a power that allows such an attack, but you can attack with either weapon.

equipment98.name: Lance
equipment98.description:
Mundane Military Weapon Melee 1H

This long, heavy spear relies on the weight and speed of a charging mount to skewer a hapless enemy. Most mounted warriors set aside their lances once they engage in close quarters fighting.

Mounted: Mounted weapons are unwieldy when not mounted, imposing a -2 penalty to attack rolls. While mounted, you deal an extra 1d[W] damage on charge attacks (Increases to +2d[W]/+3d[W] at levels 11 and 21)

Versatile: Versatile weapons are one-handed weapons that can be used two-handed. If you do, use the damage dice in parentheses instead of the weapon's usual damage dice.

equipment99.name: Light War Pick
equipment99.description:
Mundane Weapon Military Melee 1H

This smaller version of the [item:307617] is suitable as an off-hand weapon.

High Crit: Whenever you score a critical strike with this weapon add 1[W] damage. This improves by 1[W] every 5 levels, up to 6[W] at level 26.

Off-hand: An off-hand weapon is light enough that you can hold it and attack effectively with it while also holding a weapon in your main hand. You can't attack with both weapons in the same turn, unless you have a power that allows such an attack, but you can attack with either weapon.

equipment100.name: Scimitar
equipment100.description:
Mundane Weapon Military Melee 1H

High Crit: Whenever you score a critical strike with this weapon add 1[W] damage. This improves by 1[W] every 5 levels, up to 6[W] at level 26.

equipment101.name: Scourge
equipment101.description:
Mundane Weapon Military Melee 1H

This lightweight flail has leather thongs inlaid with sharpened bits of metal or bone.

Off-hand: An off-hand weapon is light enough that you can hold it and attack effectively with it while also holding a weapon in your main hand. You can't attack with both weapons in the same turn, unless you have a power that allows such an attack, but you can attack with either weapon.

equipment102.name: Throwing Hammer
equipment102.description:
Mundane Weapon Military Melee 1H

Heavy thrown: You hurl a thrown weapon from your hand, rather than using it to loose a projectile. A ranged basic attack with a heavy thrown weapon uses your Strength instead of your Dexterity for the attack and damage rolls.

Off-hand: An off-hand weapon is light enough that you can hold it and attack effectively with it while also holding a weapon in your main hand. You can't attack with both weapons in the same turn, unless you have a power that allows such an attack, but you can attack with either weapon.

equipment103.name: Trident
equipment103.description:
Mundane Weapon Military Melee 1H

This three-tined spear is weighted for throwing over short distances

Heavy thrown: You hurl a thrown weapon from your hand, rather than using it to loose a projectile. A ranged basic attack with a heavy thrown weapon uses your Strength instead of your Dexterity for the attack and damage rolls.

Versatile: Versatile weapons are one-handed weapons that can be used two-handed. If you do, use the damage dice in parentheses instead of the weapon's usual damage dice.

equipment104.name: Warhammer
equipment104.description:
Mundane Weapon Military Melee 1H

Versatile: Versatile weapons are one-handed weapons that can be used two-handed. If you do, use the damage dice in parentheses instead of the weapon's usual damage dice.

equipment105.name: War Pick
equipment105.description:
Mundane Weapon Military Melee 1H

Adapted from the common mining tool, a war pick features a compact design combined with a single, sharp point to punch through armor.

High Crit: Whenever you score a critical strike with this weapon add 1[W] damage. This improves by 1[W] every 5 levels, up to 6[W] at level 26.

Versatile: Versatile weapons are one-handed weapons that can be used two-handed. If you do, use the damage dice in parentheses instead of the weapon's usual damage dice.

equipment106.name: Glaive
equipment106.description:
Mundane Weapon Military Melee 2H

With its long, wooden haft that ends in a swordlike cutting blade, the glaive excels at keeping enemies at a distance

Reach: With a reach weapon, you can make melee attacks against enemies that are 2 squares away from you as well as against adjacent enemies. Even so, you can make opportunity attacks only against enemies adjacent to you and can flank only enemies adjacent to you.

equipment107.name: Greataxe
equipment107.description:
Mundane Weapon Military Melee 2H

High Crit: Whenever you score a critical strike with this weapon add 1[W] damage. This improves by 1[W] every 5 levels, up to 6[W] at level 26.

equipment108.name: Greatsword
equipment108.description:
Mundane Weapon Military Melee 2H

Defensive: You gain a +1 bonus to AC while wielding a defensive weapon

equipment109.name: Halberd
equipment109.description:
Mundane Weapon Military Melee 2H

A halberd's heavy head makes it a devastating weapon, while its long, wooden haft grants it the reach needed to deter would-be attackers.

Reach: With a reach weapon, you can make melee attacks against enemies that are 2 squares away from you as well as against adjacent enemies. Even so, you can make opportunity attacks only against enemies adjacent to you and can flank only enemies adjacent to you.

equipment110.name: Heavy Flail
equipment110.description:
Mundane Weapon Military Melee 2H

This two-handed variation of a standard flail can bash through armor with ease.

equipment111.name: Heavy War Pick
equipment111.description:
Mundane Weapon Military Melee 2H

This larger version of the [item:307602] delivers devastating strikes

High Crit: Whenever you score a critical strike with this weapon add 1[W] damage. This improves by 1[W] every 5 levels, up to 6[W] at level 26.

equipment113.name: Pike
equipment113.description:
Mundane Weapon Military Melee 2H

The pike is similar to a longspear, except that its superior construction and balance make it usable by gnomes, halflings, and other Small folk.

Reach: With a reach weapon, you can make melee attacks against enemies that are 2 squares away from you as well as against adjacent enemies. Even so, you can make opportunity attacks only against enemies adjacent to you and can flank only enemies adjacent to you.

equipment114.name: Bastard Sword
equipment114.description:
Mundane Weapon Superior Melee 1H

This heavier variation on the [item:239950] requires special training to cope with its weight and peculiar balance. Warriors who master the bastard sword gain the typical sword's accuracy and balance combined with the striking power of a [item:307614] or [item:307529].

Versatile: Versatile weapons are one-handed weapons that can be used two-handed. If you do, use the damage dice in parentheses instead of the weapon's usual damage dice.

equipment115.name: Craghammer
equipment115.description:
Mundane Weapon Superior Melee 1H

This dwarven hammer has a heavily weighted head, making it resemble a one-handed maul backed by a deadly spike.

Brutal N: Whenever you roll N or lower on a damage die using this power, reroll that die

Versatile: Versatile weapons are one-handed weapons that can be used two-handed. If you do, use the damage dice in parentheses instead of the weapon's usual damage dice.

equipment116.name: Drow Long Knife
equipment116.description:
Mundane Weapon Superior Melee 1H

The drow long knife is a slender blade resembling a short sword in length and weight, but balanced for throwing like a dagger or smaller blade. Featuring a haft and guard often constructed of a dream serpent’s fangs, the long knife’s design makes the weapon more difficult to wield than a normal dagger, but makes it far more deadly in the hands of a skilled user. The drow favor this weapon for its versatility in the running battles they fight through the jungles of Xen’drik. Because it causes more grievous wounds than a dagger but can still be thrown, many drow also favor it as an off-hand weapon (often wielding matched long knives).

Heavy thrown: You hurl a thrown weapon from your hand, rather than using it to loose a projectile. A ranged basic attack with a heavy thrown weapon uses your Strength instead of your Dexterity for the attack and damage rolls.

Off-hand: An off-hand weapon is light enough that you can hold it and attack effectively with it while also holding a weapon in your main hand. You can't attack with both weapons in the same turn, unless you have a power that allows such an attack, but you can attack with either weapon.

equipment117.name: Katar
equipment117.description:
Mundane Weapon Superior Melee 1H

Also known as a punching dagger, this blade has an H -shaped handle that its wielder grasps in his or her fist_ By driving this weapon at a foe with a punching motion, the katar's wielder strikes with deep and deadly attacks.

High Crit: Whenever you score a critical strike with this weapon add 1[W] damage. This improves by 1[W] every 5 levels, up to 6[W] at level 26.

Off-hand: An off-hand weapon is light enough that you can hold it and attack effectively with it while also holding a weapon in your main hand. You can't attack with both weapons in the same turn, unless you have a power that allows such an attack, but you can attack with either weapon.

equipment118.name: Kukri
equipment118.description:
Mundane Weapon Superior Melee 1H

The blade of this heavy knife curves forward for greater potency.

Brutal 2: Whenever you roll N or lower on a damage die using this power, reroll that die

Off-hand: An off-hand weapon is light enough that you can hold it and attack effectively with it while also holding a weapon in your main hand. You can't attack with both weapons in the same turn, unless you have a power that allows such an attack, but you can attack with either weapon.

equipment119.name: Parrying Dagger
equipment119.description:
Mundane Weapon Superior Melee 1H

This narrow dagger features a specially designed guard that can deflect attacks

Defensive: You gain a +1 bonus to AC while wielding a defensive weapon

Off-hand: An off-hand weapon is light enough that you can hold it and attack effectively with it while also holding a weapon in your main hand. You can't attack with both weapons in the same turn, unless you have a power that allows such an attack, but you can attack with either weapon.

equipment120.name: Serrated Pick
equipment120.description:
Mundane Weapon Superior Melee 1H

This weapon is similar to a standard pick, except for its longer, sharper, and sawlike pick head. With proper training, a warrior can inflict terrible wounds not only with the serrated pick's initial impact but also as the weapon is pulled free from a target.

High Crit: Whenever you score a critical strike with this weapon add 1[W] damage. This improves by 1[W] every 5 levels, up to 6[W] at level 26.

Versatile: Versatile weapons are one-handed weapons that can be used two-handed. If you do, use the damage dice in parentheses instead of the weapon's usual damage dice.

equipment121.name: Talenta Tangat
equipment121.description:
Mundane Weapon Superior Melee 1H

High Crit: Whenever you score a critical strike with this weapon add 1[W] damage. This improves by 1[W] every 5 levels, up to 6[W] at level 26.

Versatile: Versatile weapons are one-handed weapons that can be used two-handed. If you do, use the damage dice in parentheses instead of the weapon's usual damage dice.

equipment122.name: Tratnyr
equipment122.description:
Mundane Weapon Superior Melee 1H

Also known as the wingspear, this weapon was first crafted by the dragonborn for maximum efficiency in melee and ranged combat.

Heavy thrown: You hurl a thrown weapon from your hand, rather than using it to loose a projectile. A ranged basic attack with a heavy thrown weapon uses your Strength instead of your Dexterity for the attack and damage rolls.

Versatile: Versatile weapons are one-handed weapons that can be used two-handed. If you do, use the damage dice in parentheses instead of the weapon's usual damage dice.

equipment123.name: Triple-headed flail
equipment123.description:
Mundane Weapon Superior Melee 1H

This oversized flail has three heads for more potent attacks

Versatile: Versatile weapons are one-handed weapons that can be used two-handed. If you do, use the damage dice in parentheses instead of the weapon's usual damage dice.

equipment124.name: Waraxe
equipment124.description:
Mundane Weapon Superior Melee 1H

This weapon’s superior balance allows it to be wielded in one hand.

Brutal 1: Whenever you roll N or lower on a damage die using this power, reroll that die

equipment125.name: Whip
equipment125.description:
Mundane Weapon Superior Melee 1H

Stories of novices injuring themselves with this weapon underscore the difficulty of mastering the whip, but in the hands of an expert, a whip can drag a foe down, drive away a vicious animal, or even wrap around a loose object at a distance.

Extra Reach: With a reach weapon, you can make melee attacks against enemies that are 15' away from you as well as against adjacent enemies. Even so, you can make opportunity attacks only against enemies adjacent to you and can flank only enemies adjacent to you.

equipment126.name: Execution Axe
equipment126.description:
Mundane Weapon Superior Melee 2H

Brutal 2: Whenever you roll N or lower on a damage die using this power, reroll that die

High Crit: Whenever you score a critical strike with this weapon add 1[W] damage. This improves by 1[W] every 5 levels, up to 6[W] at level 26.

equipment127.name: Gouge
equipment127.description:
Mundane Weapon Superior Melee 2H

Brutal 1: Whenever you roll N or lower on a damage die using this power, reroll that die

equipment128.name: Greatspear
equipment128.description:
Mundane Weapon Superior Melee 2H

This reach weapon resembles a [item:307050], but its broad head and strong haft allow it to strike with increased force

Reach: With a reach weapon, you can make melee attacks against enemies that are 2 squares away from you as well as against adjacent enemies. Even so, you can make opportunity attacks only against enemies adjacent to you and can flank only enemies adjacent to you.

equipment129.name: Mordenkrad
equipment129.description:
Mundane Weapon Superior Melee 2H

First used by dwarf shock troops in battle against aberrations, this oversized two-handed hammer has a massive head studded with spikes

Brutal 1: Whenever you roll N or lower on a damage die using this power, reroll that die

equipment130.name: Spiked Chain
equipment130.description:
Mundane Weapon Superior Melee 2H

Dhakaani duelists are thought to be the first to employ this weapon, and its combination of speed and elegance supports that theory. The spiked chain delivers raking blows from a distance. Like a whip or a flail, it can also wrap around a foe's legs to send that enemy tumbling to the ground.

Extra Reach: With a reach weapon, you can make melee attacks against enemies that are 15' away from you as well as against adjacent enemies. Even so, you can make opportunity attacks only against enemies adjacent to you and can flank only enemies adjacent to you.

equipment131.name: Talenta Sarrash
equipment131.description:
Mundane Weapon Superior Melee 2H

Reach: With a reach weapon, you can make melee attacks against enemies that are 10' away from you as well as against adjacent enemies. Even so, you can make opportunity attacks only against enemies adjacent to you and can flank only enemies adjacent to you.

equipment132.name: Double Axe
equipment132.description:
Mundane Weapon Superior Melee Double

Fitted with an axe head at each end, a double axe offers increased offensive and defensive capabilities.

First end (Axe) properties

Stout: This weapon can be treated as a two-handed weapon

Second end (Axe) properties

Off-hand: An off-hand weapon is light enough that you can hold it and attack effectively with it while also holding a weapon in your main hand. You can't attack with both weapons in the same turn, unless you have a power that allows such an attack, but you can attack with either weapon.

equipment133.name: Double Flail
equipment133.description:
Mundane Weapon Superior Melee Double

First end (Flail) properties

Defensive: You gain a +1 bonus to AC while wielding a defensive weapon

Stout: This weapon can be treated as a two-handed weapon

Second end (Flail) properties

Off-hand: An off-hand weapon is light enough that you can hold it and attack effectively with it while also holding a weapon in your main hand. You can't attack with both weapons in the same turn, unless you have a power that allows such an attack, but you can attack with either weapon.

equipment134.name: Double Scimitar
equipment134.description:
Mundane Weapon Superior Melee Double

First end (Heavy Blade) properties

High Crit: Whenever you score a critical strike with this weapon add 1[W] damage. This improves by 1[W] every 5 levels, up to 6[W] at level 26.

Defensive: You gain a +1 bonus to AC while wielding a defensive weapon

Stout: This weapon can be treated as a two-handed weapon

Second end (Heavy Blade)

High Crit: Whenever you score a critical strike with this weapon add 1[W] damage. This improves by 1[W] every 5 levels, up to 6[W] at level 26.

Off-hand: An off-hand weapon is light enough that you can hold it and attack effectively with it while also holding a weapon in your main hand. You can't attack with both weapons in the same turn, unless you have a power that allows such an attack, but you can attack with either weapon.

equipment135.name: Gythka
equipment135.description:
Mundane Weapon Superior Melee Double

First end (Spear) properties

Defensive: You gain a +1 bonus to AC while wielding a defensive weapon

Heavy thrown: You hurl a thrown weapon from your hand, rather than using it to loose a projectile. A ranged basic attack with a heavy thrown weapon uses your Strength instead of your Dexterity for the attack and damage rolls.

Stout: This weapon can be treated as a two-handed weapon

Second end (Spear) properties

Off-hand: An off-hand weapon is light enough that you can hold it and attack effectively with it while also holding a weapon in your main hand. You can't attack with both weapons in the same turn, unless you have a power that allows such an attack, but you can attack with either weapon.

equipment136.name: Urgrosh
equipment136.description:
Mundane Weapon Superior Melee Double

Originally of dwarven make, this weapon has a heavy axe head at one end (dealing d12 damage) and a sharp spear point at the base of the haft (dealing d8 damage).

First end (Axe) properties

Defensive: You gain a +1 bonus to AC while wielding a defensive weapon

Stout: This weapon can be treated as a two-handed weapon

Second end (Spear) properties

Off-hand: An off-hand weapon is light enough that you can hold it and attack effectively with it while also holding a weapon in your main hand. You can't attack with both weapons in the same turn, unless you have a power that allows such an attack, but you can attack with either weapon.

equipment137.name: Sling
equipment137.description:
Mundane Weapon Simple Ranged 1H

Load Free: Ranged weapons that loose projectiles, including bows, crossbows, and slings, take some time to load. When a weapon shows “load free” on the Ranged Weapons table, that means you draw and load ammunition as a free action, effectively part of the action used to attack with the weapon. Any weapon that has the load property requires two hands to load, even if you can use only one hand to attack with it. (The sling, for example, is a one-handed weapon, but you need a free hand to load it.)

equipment138.name: Shortbow
equipment138.description:
Mundane Weapon Simple Ranged 2H

Load: Ranged weapons that loose projectiles, including bows, crossbows, and slings, take some time to load. When a weapon shows “load free” on the Ranged Weapons table, that means you draw and load ammunition as a free action, effectively part of the action used to attack with the weapon. Any weapon that has the load property requires two hands to load, even if you can use only one hand to attack with it. (The sling, for example, is a one-handed weapon, but you need a free hand to load it.) The crossbow is “load minor,” which means it requires a minor action to load a bolt into the weapon. If a power allows you to hit multiple targets, the additional load time is accounted for in the power

Rogue: Rogue weapons are special weapons that can be used with the Rogue's Sneak Attack class feature

equipment139.name: Hand Crossbow
equipment139.description:
Mundane Weapon Military Ranged 1H

Load Minor: Ranged weapons that loose projectiles, including bows, crossbows, and slings, take some time to load. The crossbow is “load minor,” which means it requires a minor action to load a bolt into the weapon. If a power allows you to hit multiple targets, the additional load time is accounted for in the power

equipment140.name: Chatka
equipment140.description:
Mundane Weapon Military Ranged 1H

Light thrown A ranged basic attack with a light thrown weapon uses your Dexterity modifier for the attack and damage rolls, unless otherwise noted in the description of the power used.

equipment141.name: Longbow
equipment141.description:
Mundane Weapon Military Ranged 2H

Load Free: Ranged weapons that loose projectiles, including bows, crossbows, and slings, take some time to load. When a weapon shows “load free” on the Ranged Weapons table, that means you draw and load ammunition as a free action, effectively part of the action used to attack with the weapon. Any weapon that has the load property requires two hands to load, even if you can use only one hand to attack with it. (The sling, for example, is a one-handed weapon, but you need a free hand to load it.)

equipment142.name: Shuriken
equipment142.description:
Mundane Weapon Superior Ranged 1H

Light thrown A ranged basic attack with a light thrown weapon uses your Dexterity modifier for the attack and damage rolls, unless otherwise noted in the description of the power used.

equipment143.name: Talentan Boomerang
equipment143.description:
Mundane Weapon Military Ranged 1H

Light thrown A ranged basic attack with a light thrown weapon uses your Dexterity modifier for the attack and damage rolls, unless otherwise noted in the description of the power used.

Returning: This weapon returns to the user after it is thrown.

equipment144.name: War Sling
equipment144.description:
Mundane Weapon Superior Ranged 1H

Load Free: Ranged weapons that loose projectiles, including bows, crossbows, and slings, take some time to load. When a weapon shows “load free” on the Ranged Weapons table, that means you draw and load ammunition as a free action, effectively part of the action used to attack with the weapon. Any weapon that has the load property requires two hands to load, even if you can use only one hand to attack with it. (The sling, for example, is a one-handed weapon, but you need a free hand to load it.)

equipment145.name: Greatbow
equipment145.description:
Mundane Weapon Military Ranged 2H

This massive, recurved bow stands as tall as a human when strung, and it fires arrows with greater power than a traditional [item:307858].

Load Free: Ranged weapons that loose projectiles, including bows, crossbows, and slings, take some time to load. When a weapon shows “load free” on the Ranged Weapons table, that means you draw and load ammunition as a free action, effectively part of the action used to attack with the weapon. Any weapon that has the load property requires two hands to load, even if you can use only one hand to attack with it. (The sling, for example, is a one-handed weapon, but you need a free hand to load it.)

equipment146.name: Superior Crossbow
equipment146.description:
Mundane Weapon Superior Ranged 2H

This crossbow appears similar to a traditional crossbow, but it has knobs and dials that allow the weapon to be fine-tuned for greater accuracy.

Load Minor: Ranged weapons that loose projectiles, including bows, crossbows, and slings, take some time to load. When a weapon shows “load free” on the Ranged Weapons table, that means you draw and load ammunition as a free action, effectively part of the action used to attack with the weapon. Any weapon that has the load property requires two hands to load, even if you can use only one hand to attack with it. (The sling, for example, is a one-handed weapon, but you need a free hand to load it.)

equipment147.name: Holy Symbol
equipment147.description:
Mundane Implement

Fashioned after the emblem or mark of a deity, Holy Symbols are used as a conduit for divine power.

equipment148.name: Ki Focus
equipment148.description:
Mundane Implement

Ki focuses come in all shapes and sizes, but most are small rocks that can fit in the palm of a hand.

equipment149.name: Orb
equipment149.description:
Mundane Implement

Orbs are perfectly smooth spheres most useful for conducting control magic

equipment150.name: Staff
equipment150.description:
Mundane Implement

Staves are typically associated with defensive magic.

equipment151.name: Tome
equipment151.description:
Mundane Implement

Tomes are enchanted books capable of holding large quantities of spells. They double as a [item:244589].

equipment152.name: Totem
equipment152.description:
Mundane Implement

Totems are made of natural materials and carved in detail to represent the natural world.

equipment153.name: Wand
equipment153.description:
Mundane Implement

Wands are made of particular mixes of enchanted wood and ingredients from a magical creature.

equipment154.name: Accurate Dagger
equipment154.description:
Mundane Implement (Superior)

You have a +1 item bonus to implement attack rolls made with this dagger

equipment155.name: Bloodthirsty Dagger
equipment155.description:
Mundane Implement (Superior)

You have edge with implement attack rolls against bloodied enemies made with this dagger

equipment156.name: Nimble Dagger
equipment156.description:
Mundane Implement (Superior)

You don't provoke opportunity attacks with ranged attacks made with this dagger

equipment157.name: Accurate Holy Symbol
equipment157.description:
Mundane Implement (Superior)

You have a +1 item bonus to implement attack rolls made with this holy symbol

equipment158.name: Channeling Holy Symbol
equipment158.description:
Mundane Implement (Superior)

You gain 3 plus one half your level temporary hit points whenever you use your Channel Divinity class feature made with this holy symbol

equipment159.name: Guiding Holy Symbol
equipment159.description:
Mundane Implement (Superior)

You have edge on attack rolls with area attack powers if an ally is in the area.

equipment160.name: Accurate Ki Focus
equipment160.description:
Mundane Implement (Superior)

You have a +1 item bonus to implement attack rolls made with this ki focus

equipment161.name: Battle Ki Focus
equipment161.description:
Mundane Implement (Superior)

You have edge on all attack rolls with this ki focus while you are bloodied

equipment162.name: Power Surge Ki Focus
equipment162.description:
Mundane Implement (Superior)

You have advantage on attack rolls for the first attack power you use in an encounter.

equipment163.name: Accurate Orb
equipment163.description:
Mundane Implement (Superior)

You have a +1 item bonus to implement attack rolls made with this orb

equipment164.name: Forceful Orb
equipment164.description:
Mundane Implement (Superior)

Your forced movement powers cast with this orb effects push, pull, or slide the target an additional 5'

equipment165.name: Imposing Orb
equipment165.description:
Mundane Implement (Superior)

Enemies have a -2 penalty to saving throws against effects applied with this orb

equipment166.name: Accurate Rod
equipment166.description:
Mundane Implement (Superior)

 You have a +1 item bonus to implement attack rolls made with this rod

equipment167.name: Initiating Rod
equipment167.description:
Mundane Implement (Superior)

You have edge on implement attack rolls against enemies at full hit points made with this rod

equipment168.name: Warding Rod
equipment168.description:
Mundane Implement (Superior)

You have a +1 item bonus to fortitude, reflex, and will defenses while you wield this rod.

equipment169.name: Accurate Staff
equipment169.description:
Mundane Implement (Superior)

You have a +1 item bonus to implement attack rolls made with this staff

equipment170.name: Defensive Staff
equipment170.description:
Mundane Implement (Superior)

You have a +1 bonus to AC while you wield this staff

equipment171.name: Summoning Staff
equipment171.description:
Mundane Implement (Superior)

While you wield this staff you don't lose a healing surge when one of your summons is reduced to 0 or fewer hit points.

equipment172.name: Accurate Tome
equipment172.description:
Mundane Implement (Superior)

You have a +1 item bonus to implement attack rolls made with this tome

equipment173.name: Ready Tome
equipment173.description:
Mundane Implement (Superior)

Choose one encounter power that you don't know that is your level or lower. During a short rest you can swap it with another encounter power you know of equal level.

equipment174.name: Binding Tome
equipment174.description:
Mundane Implement (Superior)

Your summons have a +10' item bonus to speed. This bonus also applies to alternate movement options like swim speed.

equipment175.name: Accurate Totem
equipment175.description:
Mundane Implement (Superior)

You have a +1 item bonus to implement attack rolls made with this totem

equipment176.name: Bronzewood Totem
equipment176.description:
Mundane Implement (Superior)

While you wield this totem, your summons and spirit companion gain resistance to all damage equal to 3 plus half your level. While you are affected by a primal polymorph effect, you also gain this resistance.

equipment177.name: Soarwood Totem
equipment177.description:
Mundane Implement (Superior)

While you wield this totem, the range of your ranged powers is doubled.

equipment178.name: Accurate Wand
equipment178.description:
Mundane Implement (Superior)

You have a +1 item bonus to implement attack rolls made with this wand

equipment179.name: Dueling Wand
equipment179.description:
Mundane Implement (Superior)

You gain edge on non-area ranged implement attack rolls made with this wand while neither you nor your target are adjacent to another creature

equipment180.name: Tactical Wand
equipment180.description:
Mundane Implement (Superior)

You gain edge on non-area ranged implement attack rolls made with this wand while the target is flanked by two or more of your allies.

equipment181.name: Eternal Rations (1 day)
equipment181.description:
Mundane Equipment

Made from long corn grain and the meat and milk of the gurk’ash, these supplies never spoil, providing a far more palatable dining experience than jerky and hardtack. Eternal rations are often used by traveling nobles or for ocean journeys so long that even trail rations would rot.
